review.body: To me this seemed like a cross between Lord of the Flies and The Hunger Games- funnily enough having enjoyed both of those I did really enjoy this as well. I was also intrigued to realise an Amazon reviewer also commented on this as well. The plot is original and gripping, the characters- while m...

The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald, is a book about the American life during the 1920s. The book is realistic fiction and keeps the reader sucked in with the drama between the characters. The characters, such as Gatsby, are characters that readers can decide whether they love them o...

I enjoyed this a lot more than I was anticipating and read it in only a few sittings out on the balcony. It really highlights how strong class divides were at the end of the 1800s and how much sooner children had to grow up then. I found it very easy to sympathise with the main character but also...
Really good, but can get confusing at parts
This is a sweet story about love and forgiveness. I love stories that take place during Christmas.
A great read. Left me in tears but with a satisfying ending.
Absorbing.

book.title: A Shade of Novak (A Shade of Vampire, #8)

review.body: I still don't understand why they had to turn back into vampires
Everyone would enjoy adding this book to their library.

For as much critical acclaim as this memoir got- it seemed.... pointless in the end. The author doesn't learn a lesson, nor does the reader. In the beginning, I found the writing thrilling and the escapades interesting- but soon grew tired of waiting for something to happen. It never did. Meh.

This is the seventh in the Institute series by this author, and yet again she does not disappoint. Olivia Rogers has a secret desire to be owned and mastered by a dominant man, but cannot convey these desires to her boyfriend, Jared. Unknown to her, she is being watched by Gabriel, the trainer at...
Brilliant! The Ladybird generation has grown up.

book.title: The Sister Code (D.O.R.K. Series Book Two)

review.body: This book was almost harder to write than the first. It took me so long to figure out where I wanted to go with this series! However, I think the end product is one fans of the first book will love. Prepare for drama, drama, drama!

Unlike what the cover suggests I do think that an interest in baseball, or at the very least sports, is essential to enjoy this book. Given the reputation that footballers have in this day and age I'm surprised that this book was seen as controversial when it was published. Even though it made me...

In Queue

and Gay Book Reviews

book.title: The Lost Continent: Travels in Small Town America

review.body: As this was my first experience of travel writing I didn't know what to expect and was surprised to find I really liked it. It did take me a while to get into it, hence why four stars- but from around 50 pages in it was excellent. The vivid descriptions coupled with his (perhaps unexpectedly) Bri...

book.title: The Case Of The Cupid Curse (End Street Detective Agency #1)

review.body: I was vacillating between what the hell and this is fun the whole time. I'm still not sure how I really feel, other than I love to read an M/M urban fantasy that's not completely ridiculous.

book.title: Linguistics Across Cultures: Applied Linguistics for Language Teachers

review.body:
dear sir,
i urgently this book. plz could you send me on nrajpaneru@hotmail.com
just now i am not able to pay for it but eager to read for my research work.
narendra raj paneru
Captivating. The plot is brief and scrolling fast with gathering many details in short form and in fast pace. Not so elaborate or detail oriented script but crisp and quick !!

The version of Hush I read was in black and white, with some of the panels still a work-in-progress and notes drawn onto them. Only the speech and sounds were in colour. I thought this was very effective and interesting to read although I would like to read the finished full-colour version too. I...
